Metadata: Effects of cortisol and growth hormone replacement on osmoregulation in hypophysectomiz​ed coho salmon ("Oncorhynchus kisutch")

Both cortisol and growth hormone were able to reverse partially the effects of hypophysectomy on coho salmon ("Oncorhynchus kisutch") as judged by improved seawater tolerance after long-term treatment; however, neither hormone significantly restored gill Na+,K+-ATPase activity. These results suggest that these hormones may be involved in the development of hypoosmoregulat​ory ability in coho salmon. However, the failure of either hormone to restore gill Na+,K+-ATPase activity suggests that a combination of these hormones and/or an additional hormone(s) acting in a synchronized fashion may be required for full effectiveness.
